caption:
The photograph features a large ship, the "Exxon Baltimore," with several people engaged in activities on deck. The image is filled with industrial equipment, including large reels that appear to hold cables or hoses. There are at least three visible crew members, two of whom are interacting near the aforementioned machinery. One crew member, wearing a light-colored short-sleeved shirt and dark pants, is turning or adjusting a component on the equipment, assisted by another crew member in darker clothing.

The ship itself has a large metal hull displayed prominently, with the name "Exxon Baltimore" painted along the side just below the deck. The deck is lined with metal railings, and various maritime tools and equipment are visible, contributing to a busy, working atmosphere.

Additionally, there is a lifeboat secured on top of the deck, indicating precautionary measures typical of such vessels. The background of the scene is a clear, softly blurred sky, suggesting that the photograph was taken during the daytime under good weather conditions. Overall, the composition conveys a moment of routine maritime operation, focusing on the crew's engagement with the mechanical aspects of the ship's function.
title: Prow of Exxon oil tanker in the Houston Ship Channel. Houston is one of the world's leading petroleum producing and refining centers.
